business.headline: 8th Pay Commission: When will it be formed? A look at the past trendsA Pay Commission recommends changes to the salary structure, allowances and benefits to be offered to employees depending upon the prevailing economic structure.

Explained: Why M&M share price tumbled 6% todayThe stock tumbled after the company said it will put money into a rights issue for its two subsidiaries—Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services (MMFSL) and Mahindra Lifespace Developers (MLDL).

Worried about volatile stock market? Check these 10 potential multibagger stocksThe most important factor for determining multibagger stocks is to check earnings and growth potential. Investors should seek stocks that consistently deliver revenue and profit, check metrics like PE ratio and dividend yield, and compare their performance with sectoral or broader market trends.

Planning to start SIP? 2 reasons why you should consider NPSBy investing in NPS, individuals can claim tax benefits of up to Rs 1.5 lakh under Section 80C and an additional Rs 50,000 under Section 80CCD (1B).

Explained: Why Religare Enterprises share price jumped up to 9% today Soon after the announcement, Religare's stock price climbed 8.52% to hit Rs 242 on the Bombay Stock Exchange. At around 11:24 am, shares of the company were trading 2.31% higher at Rs 228.15.

India may let foreign EV makers like Tesla test market before investing: ReportThe government may let foreign electric vehicle makers like Tesla sell cars first and invest later, with final SMEC guidelines expected soon to kickstart local manufacturing incentives.

Sensex tanks nearly 500 points. 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 461.08 points to 75,274.88 at 11:32 am and the NSE Nifty50 fell 144.45 points to trade at 22,768.70. Here are 3 things investors need to know about today's stock market downturn.

Sensex, Nifty fall as FII selling, Trump's tariff threat batter D-StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 272.61 points to 75,463.64 at around 9:51 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 91.80 points to 22,821.35.

PNB revises interest rates. Check new home, car and personal loan rates There will be zero processing fees and documentation charges on most of PNB's home loan schemes till March 31, 2025, thereby making housing loans more affordable and more accessible.
LIC Smart Pension Plan: Check eligibility and other details The Smart Pension Plan requires a minimum investment of Rs 1,00,000, while there is no cap on the maximum purchase limit.

Tesla set for India entry with first EV shipment in coming months: Report The US carmaker plans to start selling these cars in the three major cities of Mumbai, Delhi, and Bangalore around the third quarter of the year, say reports.

Sensex ends 200 points lower, Nifty below 23,000; HDFC falls over 2%Stock market closing today: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 203.22 points lower at 75,735.96, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 19.75 points to settle at 22,913.15.

entertainment.headline: Atif Aslam's surprise street performance in London leaves fans in disbelief. WatchSinger Atif Aslam's video of him performing on a London street has emerged online. This surprise clip has left many fans in disbelief.

Nadaaniyan: Ibrahim Ali Khan explains love to Miss Briganza; release date outNetflix on Thursday announced the release date of Ibrahim Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor's 'Nadaaniyan'. The film is a Gen-Z love story and is set in Delhi-Noida.

Late Linkin Park singer Chester Bennington's child comes out as transgenderLinkin Park singer Chester Bennington's child, Draven, has come out as transgender. The artiste shared the news on her social media handle, while stating her preferred pronouns in a small note.

Bridgerton 4 first look: Benedict-Sophie's love story takes centre stageThe fourth season of Bridgerton is set to spotlight Benedict Bridgerton's romance with Sophie Baek. New characters like Katie Leung's Lady Araminta Gun will add intrigue to the season.

Unveiled at the New Delhi Book Fair, it promises a deep dive into mythology coinciding with Maha Kumbh 2025.

Amortage review: Jisoo's album shakes things up like an 'earthquake'Jisoo's new EP, Amortage, released on February 14, 2025, marks her evolution as a solo artist. The EP blends pop and R&B to explore love's many facets, featuring English tracks and her own songwriting.

Bhabiji writer Manoj Santoshi battles cancer, Shilpa Shinde takes care of himActor Kavita Kaushik made an emotional post on social media, highlighting screenwriter Manoj Santoshi's struggle with liver cancer. She also mentioned actor Shilpa Shinde and thanked her for taking care of him.

The Witch review: Jinyoung, Jeong-eui shine in slow-burning psychological mysteryReleased-Sat Feb 15, 2025The Witch review: The Witch, a new K-drama starring Jinyoung and Jeong-eui, captivates with its psychological mystery and slow-burning narrative. The series, based on a popular webtoon, blends mystery, romance, and suspense, leaving viewers intrigued by the enigmatic characters and their complex interactions, says our review.

general news.headline: USAID funds for India or Bangladesh? BJP, Congress spar over new reportThe alleged USAID grant to India has rocked the political corridors since Donald Trump hinted that the funds might have been used to interfere in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls.

Even God can't fix Bengaluru in a year, we need better planning: DK ShivakumarAdmitting that Bengaluru's infrastructural situation was "extremely challenging", Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar said that the issues wouldn't be resolved soon even if "God himself descends from heaven and walks on the streets of Bengaluru".

Don't lecture: Rekha Gupta on Atishi's 'BJP cheated Delhi women voters' chargeDelhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta slammed AAP's Atishi for her comments on the BJP government failing to fulfill its promise of passing a scheme of Rs 2,500 monthly allowance to women in its first cabinet meeting.

Delhi's 'lady don' arrested: Lavish parties, luxury brands and drug ring tiesPolice had been trying to arrest Zoya for years, but she always managed to evade arrest. However, Special Cell ACP Sanjay Dutt and Inspector Sandeep Dabas finally managed to trap her in a drug case.

How 1947 Partition turned two friends into on-field cricket rivalsLala Amarnath and Fazal Mahmood, two cricketers who grew up playing cricket in Lahore, found themselves on opposite sides of history after India's Partition in 1947. Amarnath was a mentor and friend to Mahmood, and they were supposed to be part of Independent India's first international cricket tour. But history turned them into on-field rivals. While Amarnath captained India, Mahmood led Pakistan's bowling attack.

Idiot: Elon Musk feuds with astronaut over Sunita Williams' return from spaceFormer ISS commander Andreas Mogensen called out SpaceX CEO Elon Musk for claiming Joe Biden abandoned Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore in space for "political reasons". Musk was quick to counter, calling Mogensen an "idiot".

Has Trump declared Putin the winner of Russia-Ukraine war?US President Donald Trump might have decided the war in Ukraine in favour of his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin. The exclusion of Ukraine from the Riyadh talks, attacks on President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, and the US reportedly halting the supply of weapons to Kyiv are signals enough. Russia now controls 20% of Ukraine's territory and has stalled its NATO membership.

LPU's 2025 Batch Final Year Student Bags Rs 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) Placement Package-Betireddy Naga Vamsi Reddy B. Tech student has secured a 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) package with an AI robotics company and is set to graduate in May 2025. 

-Over 1,700 students have received packages ranging from Rs 10 LPA – Rs 1 Crore per annum 

-1,912 students received multiple job offers while Adireddy Vasu, secured 7 job offers, setting a rare and impressive record.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
